intro: Vohemaria messeri, commonly known as the Messeri's vohemaria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories where it can receive adequate humidity. Its botanical features make it an important subject for conservation efforts due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to habitat loss.
